item.description:
The Most INFORMAL RELAY EVER! 

Get ready and get excited for TMIRCE's upcoming special event: The Informal Relay. 

Whether you're a TMIRCE regular, someone who has never been, or anywhere in between, we want to see you at TMIRCE's first annual Informal Relay! 

Please RSVP to help us ensure we have an accurate count and can plan appropriately.

Saturday, July 16th at 10:30 AM, the inaugural Informal Relay will take place at Magazine Beach along the river in Cambridge.  This running event will feature a one-of-a-kind relay race filled with games and surprises, followed by a relaxing BBQ. 

There's nothing you need to do in advance (except RSVP so we can have an accurate count of expected attendees).  All you need to do is grab your sneakers that morning and head to Magazine Beach.  We will split folks into teams and give you all the information you need once you arrive.     

TMIRCE is all about great people having a great time, and the informal relay will continue the tradition of awesomeness and fun.  So tell your friends and be sure to join us on July 16th to be a part of making this the best run ever!    

Please RSVP on Facebook if you've got it, Meetup if you don't! 

The Running and BBQ details

Who:  The Most Informal Running Club Ever (TMIRCE)

When: Saturday, July 16th, 10:30 am  

Where: Magazine Beach on the Cambridge side of the Charles River just past the BU Bridge (we will not be meeting at City Sports on July 16th)

What: One-of-a-kind relay race filled with games and surprises, followed by a relaxing BBQ

Relay Details: Once everyone gathers, we'll split everyone up into teams and provide the relay route and other details.  No one will run more than 3 miles and you won't be running alone.  The relay will replace the weekly Saturday Fun Run at City Sports (so we will not be meeting at City Sports on July 16th).

What to expect: A well-organized, safe route with team members cheering you on.  Bring your thinking caps and appetites along with your running shoes as there will be fun along the way to keep you on your toes.  

*BBQ Details: The relay will wind down by 1:00 and we'll fire up the grill for a good old fashioned BBQ.  If you would like to bring an item to share, that would definitely be appreciated, although certainly not required.  Either way, please join us for the BBQ after the relay!  (Note: if you have items requiring refrigeration, please meet at Lindstrom Field by 10:15; someone will be there to bring things inside.)

*BBQ to be held at "The Rock" 34 Rockingham St. Cambridge, MA.

ALL ABILITY LEVELS ARE WELCOME!!!

Please RSVP to help us ensure we have an accurate count and can plan appropriately.

 

Follow Updates on FACEBOOK

item.name: The Most Informal RELAY Ever!
